text: On tap at Anvil & Stave. Pours s very dark brown with light head. Aromas of rich bourbon, sweet caramel malts and spicy dark fruit. Flavors of rich malty bourbon, raisins, complex spices and chocolately malts. Yummy.

On tap at AleSmith, in the Barrel Aged room, pours a deep dark brown / black with a small beige head. Aroma brings out decadent bourbon barrels upfront, with lots of vanilla and molasses. Flavour is no less decadent, with loads of bourbon, vanilla, molasses and treacle. Sweet, but not cloying. Masterwork of barrel aging. Fantastic.
On tap at Anvil & Stave. Brownish/amber with a small head. Sweet with bourbon, oak, malt, some vanilla and light dark fruit. The body was almost full and the finish long.

(En fût à Hamiltons Tavern): *cuvée 2015: Un vent vanillé, dérable, de caramel fruité et de noisettes aère un corps riche en saveur mais délicat de structure. Lalcool est dans le coup sans causer de maux de tête. Un de mes traitements bourbon favori dans le monde de la bière.
On tap at the Anvil and Stave. Pours a cloudy brown with small beige head that lasts. The aroma is vanilla, oak, bourbon, nuts. Medium body, caramel, vanilla, oak, boozy finish, very nice.
2014. Definitely sweet leaning with raisins and barrel dominance. Still quite smooth and decadent if not terribly complex.

Draft @ the brewery. Pours a dark amber color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty spicy woody bourbon caramel aroma with hints of dark fruit. Has a sweetish malty spicy woody bourbon caramel flavor. Has a sweetish malty woody bourbon vanilla caramel finish with hints of dark fruit.

Bottle purchased in September 2016 and traveled all the way from Alesmith in San Diego to Modra/Slovakia and we are enjoying this epic brew right now having Christmas dinner. Overall it is a grand, colossal and epic beer!

Hazy darker chestnut color, moderate to small head, some lace/retention. Aroma of bourbon, vanilla, darker dried fruits, caramel, brown sugar. Full bodied, moderately boozy, sweet finish, moderate alcohol. Quite pleasant.

2015 vintage. Deep, warm brown colors with burgundy highlights. So much dark fruits in the aroma that its hard to pick up anything else. Tastes fruity as hell, too. A lot of raisins, plums, black grapes, figs, etc. Some herbs, molasses, licorice, oak, & vanilla in the far background. Booze stands out a lot at the end! Full body, sticky, low carbonation. Overall its good but somehow still disappointing. Expected much more balance & complexity but was just two-dimensional.
On draft at the brewerry. 2014 version. Pours a clear black cola with a tan head. Aroma of bourbon and pit fruit. Flavors of prunes, bourbon and oak. Rich and delicious.

2015 BA (released 2016). Pours dark brown/red with a small brown head that fades leaving a spotty cap, small ring and minimal lacing. AROMA: rich malt, caramel, vanilla, brown sugar, honey, dark stone fruit sweetness, raisins, roasty, smoke, herbal, molasses, nuts, earthy, spices, toffee, licorice and floral. TASTE: white wine acidity, rich malt, caramel, vanilla, brown sugar, honey, nuts, dark stone fruit, raisins, roasty, floral, licorice, herbal, spices, smoke, molasses, honey, alcohol, earthy and herbal hops. AFTER TASTE: wine acidity, caramel, brown sugar and dark stone fruit with a medium body alcohol/spice warmth.

2014 and 2015 sample at Anvil & Stave. This brew is a cloudy reddish-brown color with a medium light beige head that diminishes steadily to a film. Small patches of lacing on the glass. Oak, malt and vanilla in the nose. Full-bodied with flavors of roast malt, oaky bourbon and vanilla. The finish is moderately boozy with a bourbon and malt aftertaste. Good beer overall.

Accidental 2015 version draft in the speakeasy. Clear bronze color with copper highlights. Aroma is pretty boozy but also some molasses. Flavor is much more mild with sweet, syrupy malt and some figs. Pretty nice.
Draft. Pours deep brown with a beige head. Sweet bourbon and vanilla, mild roasted malts, and marshmallow, with moderate sweetness throughout and a bit of a boozy bite. Good stuff.

[ Keg ][ 3oz ][ AleSmith Observation Room ][ $4 ][ Mini Globe ][ 6.29.16 Consumed ]
>> 2014 Vintage. Murky maroon color, no foam, great alcohol legs upon swirl. Nose is oxidized with mushroom, sherry, savory like marmite. Flavor has a soft warming body, salted caramel, toffee. Rich and well integrated. Definitely a sipper, but quite nice.
